message:
Message-ID: <test1@enron.com>
Date: Mon, 15 Oct 2001 09:30:00 -0700
From: jeff.skilling@enron.com
To: kenneth.lay@enron.com, andrew.fastow@enron.com
Subject: Q4 Energy Trading Strategy

We need to discuss our energy trading strategy for the upcoming quarter.
This is critical for Enron Corp's success in the California market.

Best regards,
Jeff Skilling

Message-ID: <test2@enron.com>
Date: Mon, 15 Oct 2001 10:15:00 -0700
From: kenneth.lay@enron.com
To: jeff.skilling@enron.com
CC: rebecca.mark@enron.com
Subject: Re: Q4 Energy Trading Strategy

Agreed. Let's schedule a meeting with the risk management team.

Ken

Message-ID: <test3@enron.com>
Date: Tue, 16 Oct 2001 08:00:00 -0700
From: sherron.watkins@enron.com
To: kenneth.lay@enron.com
Subject: Accounting Concerns

I have serious concerns about our accounting practices related to
special purpose entities and off-balance-sheet transactions.

This could pose significant risks to Enron Corporation.

Sherron Watkins

Message-ID: <test4@enron.com>
Date: Wed, 17 Oct 2001 14:30:00 -0700
From: louise.kitchen@enron.com
To: greg.whalley@enron.com, mark.frevert@enron.com
Subject: EnronOnline Platform Updates

The EnronOnline trading platform processed $2.1B in transactions yesterday.
We're seeing strong activity in natural gas and power contracts.

System performance metrics attached.

Louise Kitchen
President, Enron Online

Message-ID: <test5@enron.com>
Date: Thu, 18 Oct 2001 11:00:00 -0700
From: vince.kaminski@enron.com
To: risk-committee@enron.com
Subject: Portfolio Risk Analysis

Attached is the latest portfolio risk analysis for our energy derivatives.

Key findings:
- VaR has increased 15% due to California exposure
- Credit risk on counterparties remains stable
- Recommend hedging strategies for Q4

Vince Kaminski
Managing Director, Research
